definition: to bury sth along with the dead/sacrificial grave goods
to be buried with the dead/to die for a cause

sentences.english: Hongshan culture jade large tomb tombs seem to have a certain combination.
sentences.chinese: 紅山文化大型墓殉葬的玉器似乎都有一定的組合。

sentences.english: The older man was buried with jade and amber collars and bracelets and pearl ornaments.
sentences.chinese: 年長的男子的殉葬品有玉器琥珀項圈手鐲，珍珠飾品。

sentences.english: She was reminding him he could do nothing so flamboyant as to die with her.
sentences.chinese: 她在提醒着他無法這樣壯麗的同她殉葬。

sentences.english: Sacrificial burial has been a custom in India, not often practised today.
sentences.chinese: 殉葬是印度一種葬禮習俗。

sentences.english: Europe's prehistoric hunter-gatherers may have practiced human sacrifice, a new study claims.
sentences.chinese: 一項新的調查聲稱，歐洲史前採獵者可能實行殉葬。

sentences.english: We are all sarifical objects for time.
sentences.chinese: 我們都是時間的殉葬品。

sentences.english: More people buried alive meant higher social status of the dead.
sentences.chinese: 殉葬的人越多，越顯示出他的社會地位。

sentences.english: The number of buffalos sacrificed also determines the family inheritance.
sentences.chinese: 殉葬水牛的數量也能看出這家的繼承情況。

sentences.english: What you are doing is burying yourself alive with the old system.
sentences.chinese: 你這樣做簡直就是在做舊制度的殉葬品。

definition: to be buried with or next to dead person (of deceased's partner, or of funerary objects)
to be buried alive as sacrifice (together with husband or superior)
funerary objects (items buried together with the dead)
to sacrifice one's life by loyalty (to one's prince, one's husband etc)
to commit suicide on the orders of a sovereign (old)
an execution/to put sb to death
to bury husband and wife together/joint interment
